But the family that most signally befriended Archias, extending to him a hospitalily which probably ended only with his life, was that of the Luculli. Three members of this famous house are connected with the career of our poet. The head of the family, L. Licinius Lucullus, father of Lucius and Marcus, was absent in Sicily when Archias first came to Romo, 102 nc. He was impeached for malpractices on his return, and had to retire into exile. It seems probable that he settled in Heraclea; here, at any rate, at some date between 101 and 89 B.c., a visit was paid by his son M. On his visit to Heraclea much of the present suit against Archias turns. It is plain that the Luculli possessed influence there.
